name: src/Angie.js
Angie
description:
This is the default Angie class. It is instantiated and given
the namespace `global.app`. Static methods are available via this
instance.

It is ill advised to tray and redefine the native app as it is tightly coupled
with the resource pipeline & webserver, instead, use the Angie class to
access commonly used static methods.

name: constant
description: Creates an Angie constant provider

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the constant being created

params.name: obj
params.description: The object value

return.description: this instanceof Angie

name: service
description: Creates an Angie service provider. This must be an object.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the service being created

params.name: obj
params.description: The object value

return.description: this instanceof Angie

name: factory
description: Creates an Angie service provider. This must be a function.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the factory being created

params.name: fn
params.description: The function value

return.description: this instanceof Angie

name: Controller
description:
Creates an Angie Controller provider. This must be a function that
returns an object or an object.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the factory being created

params.name: obj
params.description: The Controller value

params.name: obj.template
params.description:
An actual HTML template to be added as a
byproduct of the Controller

params.name: obj.templatePath
params.description:
The path to an HTML template to be
added as a byproduct of the Controller

return.description: this instanceof Angie

name: directive
description:
Creates an Angie directive provider. The second parameter
of the directive function must be an object, with properties defining the
directive itself.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the constant being created

params.name: obj
params.description: The directive value, returns directive params

params.name: obj().Controller
params.description: The associated directive controller

params.name: obj().priority
params.description:
A number representing the directive's
priority, relative to the other declared directives

params.name: obj().replace
params.description:
Does the directive root get replaced by
its inner HTML?

params.name: obj().restrict
params.description:
What HTML components can parse this directive:
   'A': attribute
   'E': element
   'C': class

params.name: obj().link
params.description:
A function to fire after the directive is
parsed

params.name: obj().template
params.description:
An actual HTML template to be added as a
byproduct of the directive

params.name: obj().templatePath
params.description:
The path to an HTML template to be
added as a byproduct of the directive

return.description: this instanceof Angie

name: $$loadDependencies
description:
Load all project dependencies from an Array of dependencies
specified in the AngieFile.json. This will load packages in the order
they are specified, exposing any application Modules to the application
and prepping any application configuration in the nested modules. It will
not load duplicate modules. Dependencies are typically declared as a
node_module path, but can also be declared as a singular (main) file.

params.name: param
params.description:
dependencies The Array of dependencies
specified in the parent or localized AngieFile.json

name: $$bootstrap
description:
Load all of the files associated with the parent and child Angie
applications. This will transpile and deliver all modules associated with
both the parent and child applications.

params.name: param
params.description: dir The dir to scan for modules

name: src/Config.js
src/Server.js
src/controllers/$ScopeProvider.js
$scope
description: $scope is the instance of $$ScopeProvider allocated to resources

name: $$ScopeProvider
description:
$ScopeProvider is the parent class on which all of the content shared
across the request can be shared. It also provides methods for messaging
against and across the scope.

name: $on
description: Sets up an event listener on the scope

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} A representation of whether the listener was attached

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the message to call the event listener

params.name: fn
params.description: The handler to call on message

return.description: A representation of whether the listener was attached

name: $broadcast
description: Calls an event listener on the scope

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} A representation of whether the listeners were called

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the message to call the event listener

params.name: async
params.description: Should the handlers be called async?

return.description: A representation of whether the listeners were called

name: $watch
description:
Sets up an observer on an object (shallow). This function does not
support dots.

params.name: obj
params.description: The object upon which to set up the handler

params.name: fn
params.description: The handler to call on message

return.description: The passed object

name: $$off
description: Removes all of the handlers from a listener

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} A representation of whether the listeners were attached

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the message to call the event listener

return.description: A representation of whether the listeners were attached

name: $$removeWatch
description: Removes all of the watchers from an object

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} A representation of whether the listeners were unattached

params.name: obj
params.description: The object from which to remove the handler

return.description: A representation of whether the listeners were unattached

name: $$handlers
description: Sets up or removes all handlers

params.name: $handlers
params.description: An optional list of handlers

return.description: handlers

name: src/factories/$CacheFactory.js
src/factories/$Compile.js
$document
description:
$document is provided to any directive which has included it. It
is a NodeJS representation of a window.document object.

This should not be used to transform document properties as the document
provided by the browser and $document are not the same instance.

name: $compile
description:
$compile is provided to any service, Controller, directive, Model, or
view which has included it as an argument.

$compile is responsible for parsing all templates and templatePath files that
are passed into a Controller. It will parse all triple bracketted statements,
all ngie-native directives, and all custom directives.

The triple bracket statement is utilized as a result of the Angular/Mustache/
Handlebars standard of two brackets. While you can also do three brackets in
either of the latter cases, it is generally considered unsafe and most
definitely so in this case.

Native directives are called "ngie" to avoid namespace collisions. Dirty
checking is performed on directive names for camelCasing,
underscore_separation, and dash-separation.

It can also be referenced as `app.services.$compile`.

unknown.tagValue: {function} Template function, compiles in whatever scope is passed

params.name: t
params.description: Template string to be processed

return.description: Template function, compiles in whatever scope is passed

name: $window
description:
$window is provided to any directive which has included it. It
is a NodeJS representation of a window object.

This should not be used to transform window properties as the window
provided by the browser and $window are not the same instance.

name: src/factories/$RouteProvider.js
$RouteProvider
description:
$RouteProvider is provided to any service, Controller, directive, Model,
or view which has included it as an argument as ""$Routes"

It can also be referenced as `app.services.$Routes` or imported as
'$RouteProvider' from the Angie Path.

name: when
description: Sets up a route as a possible endpoint in an Angie application..

unknown.tagValue:
{function} Template function, compiles in whatever scope is
passed

params.name: str
params.description:
String or RegExp to denote the endpoint
path

params.name: obj.templatePath
params.description: Optional template path

params.name: obj.template
params.description: Optional template html

params.name: obj.Controller
params.description: The name of the associated Controller

params.name: obj.*
params.description:
A deep route with another route object
to associate with a route consisting of the original path added to the
new key

return.description:
Template function, compiles in whatever scope is
passed

name: otherwise
description:
Sets a defaulted path in the event that none of the other routes
or route patterns are matching. If this is a relative path, it will match
absolutely. If this is a full path, it will result in a 301 redirect.

params.name: path
params.description: URL string to set as the "otherwise" path

return.description: The same URL string

name: fetch
description: Returns all of the set application routes

unknown.tagValue: {object} Routes object (inc. RegExps) and otherwise path objects

return.description: Routes object (inc. RegExps) and otherwise path objects

name: $$clear
description:
$Routes.$$clear is a helper method designated to clear out all
of the routes in the test environment. Don't call it or you might have a
bad time.

name: $stringsToRegExp
description: Take RegExp literals or strings and return a new RexExp

params.name: str
params.description: Arguments of strings or RegExp literals

return.description: Concatenated RegExps joined by "/"

name: $$parseURLParams
description:
$Routes.$$parseURLParams is a function that will strip the
paramters out of RegExp pattern routes

It is a private method

unknown.tagValue: {function} Template function, compiles in whatever scope is passed

params.name: t
params.description: Template string to be processed

return.description: Template function, compiles in whatever scope is passed

name: src/factories/$TemplateCache.js
$resourceLoader
description:
$resourceLoader is a factory that will attach a JavaScript resource
to any respose. It will attach it inside of the body if the file is requested
to be attached on an HTML response.
todo:
Auto load Angular, jQuery, Underscore, etc. from their names alone
via Bower installs

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} Whether this function successfully finished (not an
indication that the resource was actually attached)

params.name: param
params.description:
filename Valid JS filename in Angie static
directories

params.name: param
params.description:
loadStyle How is this resource attached to the
document. Options:
    'src':       Include a script tag with the name of the resource
    'inline':    Include the resource content inline

return.description:
Whether this function successfully finished (not an
indication that the resource was actually attached)

name: src/index.js
src/services/$Request.js
src/services/$Resource.js
src/services/$Responses.js
src/services/BaseRequest.js
BaseRequest
description:
The BaseRequest class processes all of the incoming Angie requests. It
can be required using a module import, but probably should not be unless it
it being subclassed for a dependency package.

name: $$route
description:
This method performs the route on the incoming request object and
the associated path. If there is a matching path using RegExp, the
existing matched params will be parsed out of the path. If not, a standard
router will be used.

return.description:
BaseRequest.prototype.$controllerPath or
BaseRequest.prototype.otherPath

name: $controllerPath
description:
$controllerPath is fired once a request has been routed. It fires
the controller once dependencies have been injected.

Cases:
    Controller & templatePath (default): Compiles template in scope
    Controler & template: Compiles template in scope
    Controller: fires Controller, expects response
    TemplatePath (default): Serves template, expects compilation on
frontend
    Template: Serves template, expects compilation on frontend

If the loadDefaultScriptFile option is added to AngieFile.json with a
valid (existing and of type ".js") JavaScript filename, this default
script file will be loaded.

name: src/util/$ExceptionsProvider.js
src/util/$MimeTypeProvider.js
$MimeTypeProvider
description:
$MimeTypeProvider is predominately used internally to specify a properties
mime type on response objects. It can also be used in special cases for
routing views.
Find a mime type based on ext

params.name: ext
params.description: [param='html'] Content-Type to check against

return.description: An approximated Content-Type

name: fromPath
description: Find a mime type based on a pathname

params.name: path
params.description: File path to check against

return.description: An approximated Content-Type

name: src/util/decorators.js
src/util/scaffold/project.js
$$ProjectCreationError
description:
$$createProject is the function called when the CLI attempts to create
a project from the command line. This scaffolds the main folder in the
specified location or no folder and then folders for commonly used providers
and the Angie config file (AngieFile.json).

The CLI function to create a project will ask the user a series of questions.
The result of these questions will be passed to the AngieFile.json.

This function will gracefully exit the process if successful and exit with
errors if unsuccessful.

params.name: args
params.description: A list of arugments passed from the CLI parser

params.name: args.name
params.description:
The name of the project being created. This must
consist of letters, dashes, & underscores

params.name: args.location
params.description:
[param=process.cwd()] The location in which the
inner files of the project are created. CWD if no location is specified.

name: src/util/shell.js
src/util/util.js
$StringUtil
description:
Util is a silent utility class which is not available via any provider
on the app object. The only way to access the methods on this class is to
import the module. It holds methods quintessential to string manipulation.

name: removeLeadingSlashes
description: Util helper to replace leading slashes

unknown.tagValue: {string} The str param with stripped leading slashes

params.name: str
params.description: [param=''] String to process

return.description: The str param with stripped leading slashes

name: removeTrailingSlashes
description: Util helper to replace trailing slashes

unknown.tagValue: {string} The str param with stripped trailing slashes

params.name: str
params.description: [param=''] String to process

return.description: The str param with stripped trailing slashes

name: removeTrailingLeadingSlashes
description: Util helper to replace leading and trailing slashes

unknown.tagValue: {string} The str param with stripped trailing and leading slashes

params.name: str
params.description: [param=''] String to process

return.description: The str param with stripped trailing and leading slashes

params.name: str

return.description: The str param converted to camelCase

name: toUnderscore

unknown.tagValue: {string} The str param converted to underscore_separation

Util helper to perform `toDash` or `toUnderscore` style string

name: $FileUtil
description:
$FileUtil is a silent utility class which is not available via any provider
on the app object. The only way to access the methods on this class is to
import the module. It holds methods quintessential to file management.

name: find
description: Util helper to help find files in the specified root

params.name: root
params.description: The root directory in which to find files

params.name: target
params.description: The desired file name

return.description: The content of the file

name: $Util
description:
Util is a slient utility class which is not available via any provider
on the app object. The only way to access the methods on this class is to
import the module.

name: noop
description: $Util empty function call helper

return.description: undefined
